question: A line used to show the center of a round object is
explanation: A center line is used to indicate the center of a round object in technical drawings, typically shown as a dashed line with alternating long and short segments.

question: What is another name for multiview drawing?
explanation: A multiview drawing, also known as an orthographic drawing, represents an object from multiple views (e.g., front, top, side) projected onto principal planes.

question: Selection of a drawing pencil is determined by

options.a: Type and quality of drawing paper
options.b: Type and quality of drawing board
options.c: How thick and dark you want the line to be.

explanation: The choice of drawing pencil (e.g., H, B grades) depends on the desired line thickness and darkness, with harder pencils for lighter lines and softer ones for darker lines.

question: If an oblique view is drawn to half its thickness, it is called:
explanation: In a cabinet oblique drawing, the depth axis is drawn at half scale to reduce distortion, unlike cavalier projection where depth is full scale.

question: A circular or semicircular tool for measuring an angle is
explanation: A protractor is a circular or semicircular tool used to measure or draw angles in degrees.

question: What is an erasing shield?

options.a: An instrument with apertures of varying size and shape to allow precision erasing while protecting the rest of the drawing.
options.b: Used for rubbing out pencil and also for pen mistakes.

explanation: An erasing shield is a metal or plastic tool with various apertures that allows precise erasing of specific areas while protecting the rest of the drawing.

question: Which one of the following is incorrect?

options.a: Title blocks are located at the right hand lower corner of a drawing sheet
options.b: Tolerances can be described inside the title block.
options.c: Dimension lines can be used without arrow heads

explanation: Dimension lines require arrowheads to clearly indicate the extent of the dimension, making option c incorrect.

question: Which of the following statements about technical drawings is incorrect?

options.a: A circle is dimensioned by its diameter; an arc by its radius.
options.b: Hidden lines are always shown in pictorial drawings.
options.c: Leader lines are drawn parallel to dimension lines.

explanation: Leader lines indicate specific features or notes and are not necessarily parallel to dimension lines, which show measurements.  Option B is also incorrect; hidden lines are often omitted in pictorial drawings to improve clarity.

question: Which view shows the true shape and size of an inclined surface?
explanation: An auxiliary view is drawn perpendicular to an inclined surface to show its true shape and size, unlike frontal or profile views.

question: When dimensions are placed to be read from one direction, this method is known as
explanation: The unidirectional method places all dimensions to be read from one direction, typically the bottom of the drawing, for clarity.

question: Which one of the following is not a principal plane of projection?
explanation: The principal planes of projection are horizontal, frontal, and profile planes; an oblique plane is not a standard principal plane.

question: A method of describing and putting the exact shape and size of a 3-dimensional object on a 2-dimensional paper is called
explanation: Orthographic projection represents a 3D object in 2D by projecting its views onto perpendicular planes.

question: When an object is between the plane and the observer, the projection is called
explanation: In first-angle projection, the object is placed between the observer and the projection plane, common in some international standards.

question: It is possible to use all four angles of projections for drawing.
explanation: Only first-angle and third-angle projections are commonly used; second and fourth angles are impractical and rarely used.

question: A plane onto which the side face of an object is projected
explanation: The profile plane is used to project the side face of an object in orthographic projection.

question: In Sectioning, if half the object is removed by a cutting plane, then it is called
explanation: A half section shows one half of an object as if cut away, revealing internal features while retaining part of the external view.

question: Section lines are drawn at an angle of to the object

options.c: At any angle other than the above angles

explanation: Section lines are typically drawn at 45 degrees to the object to distinguish the cut surface, not at 90 or 180 degrees.

question: The depth of an object can be obtained from:
explanation: An auxiliary view provides the true depth of an object, especially for inclined surfaces, unlike front or top views.

question: Which one of the following is correct about oblique drawing?

options.a: One face of the object is parallel to one of the plane of projection.
options.b: The three axes are 90 deg. apart.
options.c: Circles appear as ellipse in all 3 faces of the drawing.

explanation: In oblique drawing, one face is parallel to the projection plane, with the depth axis drawn at an angle (e.g., 45 degrees).

question: In isometric drawing the three axes are deg apart
explanation: In isometric drawing, the three axes are 120 degrees apart to create a balanced 3D representation.

question: Which instrument is used to draw irregular curves?
explanation: A French curve is a drafting tool used to draw smooth, irregular curves that cannot be drawn with a compass.

question: A seven-sided figure is
explanation: A heptagon is a polygon with seven sides, while an octagon has eight and a nonagon has nine.

question: Write 3 uses of a T-square
explanation: A T-square is used for: 1) Drawing horizontal lines, 2) Aligning drawing paper on a drafting board, and 3) Supporting other tools like triangles for vertical or angled lines. The provided options contain errors and are not accurate.

question: In 3rd angle projection, Front view is projected to:
explanation: In third-angle projection, the front view is projected onto the frontal plane, which is perpendicular to the observer’s line of sight.

question: When drawing an Auxiliary view, the projectors are:

options.c: At 45 deg to the inclined surface

explanation: Auxiliary view projectors are perpendicular to the inclined surface to show its true shape and size.

question: An assembly drawing is one which includes all necessary information for a part or an assembly in the final installed position in the aircraft
explanation: An assembly drawing shows all parts in their final installed position, including necessary details for assembly in the aircraft.

question: The American standard of drawing sheet equivalent to the ISO standard A4 is represented by letter
explanation: The American standard drawing sheet size equivalent to ISO A4 (8.27 x 11.69 inches) is ANSI A (8.5 x 11 inches).

question: With regard to lettering, the shapes of letters are not described as part of drawing standards.

options.c: There are conditions lettering are part of drawing standards but not always

explanation: Drawing standards, such as those by ASME or ISO, specify lettering characteristics (e.g., size, style) for consistency and clarity.

question: The title block used on working drawings should include the
explanation: A title block typically includes the sheet number, part name, scale, and other metadata, but line type is not a standard inclusion.

question: A scale factor of technical drawing which represents a reduced scale is
explanation: A reduced scale, such as 1:2, means the drawing is half the size of the actual object, unlike 1:1 (full scale) or 2:1 (enlarged scale).

question: The edges of a cube in isometric projection make angles with each other:
explanation: In isometric projection, the edges of a cube are drawn at 120-degree angles to each other to represent 3D perspective.

question: The type of line that projects from an object for the express purpose of locating a dimension is a line.
explanation: Extension lines project from an object to define the extent of a dimension, connecting the object to the dimension line.

question: A circular arc is dimensioned in the view where you see its true shape by giving the value for its:
explanation: A circular arc is dimensioned by its radius in the view where its true shape is visible, typically with a leader line pointing to the arc.

question: A thin solid line directing attention to a note or dimension and starting with an arrowhead or dot.
explanation: A leader line is a thin solid line that directs attention to a note or dimension, starting with an arrowhead or dot.

question: In multi-view drawing it is common practice to include three views, the front, the top and the right side. If no dimensions are required on the right side view the drafter can
explanation: If the right side view provides no unique information or dimensions, it can be eliminated to simplify the drawing.

question: The type of auxiliary view, in which a break line is used to indicate the imaginary in the views:
explanation: A partial auxiliary view uses a break line to show only a portion of the view, indicating an imaginary break in the object.
